column1: Introducing multiple entry in Location
column28:
Go on the Location page (which is a sub menu of the Organisation menu) and press add button and see if it's possible to entry multiple location. 

steps:
Go in Application OrangeHRM, in the log in you have to enter the username 'Admin' and pass 'admin123', now you go on the 'Admin', after you press admin you are redirect to another page, in the upper bar and select 'Organization', a list of sub menu will appear, select the 'Location', 'ADD' button, here we don't have an option to add multiple entry.

Expected result: The multiple location is allow to be added.
Actual result: We don't have an option to add multiple entry in the same time. We can add just one entry per time.

column1: Introducing multiple job title
column28:
Go on the Job Title page and press on the Add button an try to entry multiple items.

Steps
Go in Application OrangeHRM, in the log in you have to enter the username 'Admin' and pass 'admin123', now you go on the 'Admin', after you press admin you are redirect to another page, in the upper bar and select 'Job', a list of sub menu will appear, select the 'Job Title', 'ADD" button, here we don't have an option to add multiple entry.

Expected result: You can add multiple entry, the multiple items are added.

Actual result: We don't have an option to add multiple entry in the same time. We can add just one entry per time.

column1: Add working hours in work shift list
column28:
Navigate on the work shift page which is a sub menu from Job, click on the Add button and complete the field and save.

Steps
Go in Application OrangeHRM, in the log in you have to enter the username 'Admin' and pass 'admin123', now you go on the 'Admin', after you press admin you are redirect to another page, in the upper bar and select 'Job', and a list would appear, choose 'Work shifts' a new window appear, I press on the 'Add' button, redirect me to a new page, A new form appear with a field mandatory 'Working hours', and other filed at a fist view are optional, I complete the mandatory field and press save

Expected result: Working hours is added to the work shift list.

Actual result: In the moment when I press save one of the optional text box it's made rend and a message appear "Required".

column1: Employment status complete from should not be letting you to add number
column28:
Navigate on the employment page and press the add button (to add an employment status), complete all the fields with a name (number) and press save. 

Steps:
Go in Application OrangeHRM, in the log in you have to enter the username 'Admin' and pass 'admin123', now you go on the 'Admin', after you press admin you are redirect to another page, in the upper bar and select 'Job', and a list would appear, choose 'Employment status' a new window appear, I press on the 'Add' button, redirect me to a new page, A new form appear with a field 'Name' of employment status, the text box is mandatory (I write 1234), and press on 'save'.

Expected Result: The name (number) of employment status should not be added.

Actual result: The name of employment status was added successfully, and I was redirect to the principal page of 'employment status' where is a list with all employment status.

column1: Modules
column28: This feature enables the HR Admin to configure the display/hide settings of the modules of the system. To configure the module display settings, go to Admin>> Configuration>> Modules and the screen will appear. Click â€œEdit â€œto edit module display. You may select from the list the modules you want to be displayed/hidden. Click â€œSaveâ€ one module configuration is completed.

column1: Localization (Date Format Localization)
column28: This feature allows the HR Admin to set up the date format that will be reflected throughout the whole system. Once you have configured the localization settings, click â€œSaveâ€.

column1: Localization (Language Localization)
column28: This feature enables the HR Admin to configure the language settings and translate the OrangeHRM system to the language of your choice. To configure localization settings, go to Admin>> Configuration>> Localization and the screen would appear. Click â€œEditâ€ to edit the fields. The default language of the system is US English however you may also use an already set up browser language to translate the system to the language of choice. For example: If you are using Firefox as your browser and itâ€™s translated in UK English language and you want to use this particular language, click on the â€œUse Browser Language if setâ€ and select from the â€œSupported Languageâ€ provided. The language pack tool can also be obtained from the website by clicking on â€œLanguage and font helpâ€ where you will be diverted to the web page or by simply browsing through the OrangeHRM Website ([www.orangehrm.com|http://www.orangehrm.com] >> Community>> Translators).

column1: Email Subscriptions
column28: This feature will allow the admin to subscribe to email notifications that will be sent to the employees and supervisors in the system. A copy of the mail will be sent to the email address specified by the Admin. He/she can also select what copies of notifications he should receive. To subscribe to a notification type, go to Admin>> Configuration>> Email Subscriptions and a screen would appear. The HR Admin may also add other subscribers to the following notifications by clicking on the notification types and you will be directed to the screen. Once the fields are added, click â€œSaveâ€. The entry will then be listed and multiple entries of subscribers for a particular notification type may also be added or deleted. When you click â€œBackâ€ you will be directed to the â€œEmail Notificationâ€ screen with the added notification subscriber reflected on the screen.

column1: Email Configuration
column28: Configuration of mail settings is essential to accommodate sending and receiving notifications related to the operations performed within the OrangeHRM application (Ex: leave management). To configure the mail settings, go to Admin>> Configuration>>Email Configuration, a screen would appear. Enter the fields accurately by clicking â€œEditâ€, and then a test mail to an email address of your choice could be sent to check functionality. Click â€œSaveâ€ when you have entered all the settings and you may check the email account if you specified an address to receive the test mail.

column1: Configuration
column28: This feature allows you to subscribe and receive notifications and to configure the parameters in setting up the email so notifications will be sent to relevant persons which will quicken the communication processes. It also allows the HR admin to configure language localization for the entire system, set up a date format and enable/disable module display.

column1: Nationalities
column28: This feature allows the HR Admin to define the different nationalities that present in the company which can later be used in the PIM Module. Various nationalities are already pre-defined. To add a nationality, go to Admin>> Nationalities and click â€œAddâ€, a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. A list of nationalities would appear once a â€œNationalityâ€ is added. You may also add multiple entries of nationalities. To delete a nationality, click on the check box next to the â€œNationalityâ€â€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Memberships
column28: This feature allows the HR Admin to define different membership details of the employees which can be later used in the PIM Module. To add a membership, go to Admin>> Qualifications>> Membership and click â€œAddâ€, a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. A list of membership(s) would appear once a â€œMembershipâ€ is added. To view membership details, click on â€œMembershipâ€ name. You may also add multiple entries of memberships. To delete a membership, click on the check box next to the â€œMembershipâ€â€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Languages
column28: Different types of languages that employees in your company speak can be defined here and can be used in The PIM Module later. To add an entry, go to Admin>> Qualifications>>Languages and click â€œAddâ€, a screen  would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. A list of languages would appear once a â€œLanguageâ€ type is added. You may also add multiple entries of languages. To delete language types click on the check box next to the â€œLanguageâ€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Licenses
column28: You can define various types of licenses which can be later used in the PIM Module. To add an entry go to Admin>> Qualifications>> Licenses and click â€œAddâ€, a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. A list of license type(s) would appear once a â€œLicenseâ€ type is added. You may also add multiple entries of licenses. To delete a license type click on the check box next to the â€œLicenseâ€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Education
column28: You can define various types of educational qualifications which can be later used in the PIM Module. To add an entry select Admin>> Qualifications>> Education and click â€œAddâ€, a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. A list of education would appear once an â€œEducationâ€ entry is added. You may also add multiple entries of skills. To delete education type click on the check box next to the â€œEducationâ€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Skills
column28: You can define various sets of skills which can be later used on the PIM Module. To add an entry go to Admin>> Qualifications>> Skills and click â€œAddâ€ and a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the fields are added. A list of skill(s) would appear once a â€œSkillâ€ is added. You may also add multiple entries of skills. To delete a skill click on the check box next to the â€œskillâ€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Qualifications
column28: This feature allows you to define all information with regards to employeesâ€™ qualifications. The sub-menu consists of: â— Skills â— Education â— Licenses â— Languages

column1: Structure
column28: This feature allows the admin to define the hierarchy of the company by defining sub units. Since the parent company is already defined in the General Information, it would automatically appear in the Company Structure screen. You need to define the company name of the parent company before you create the Company Structure. To add a sub- unit to the company structure, go to Admin>> Organization>> Structure and click on [+] and the screen would appear. Company Structure may be defined according to the companyâ€™s specifications and hierarchy. When entering the fields, you need to specify if the sub-unit is a Department, Division or Team. Once you have entered the field, click â€œSaveâ€ and the Sub-Unit will appear You may also add further sub-units by clicking [+] option next to the relevant fields to indicate the hierarchy levels of the company and create a pyramidal structure of your organization. To delete an entry, you can simply click â€œ[x]â€ next to the relevant sub units. Click â€œDoneâ€ below the screen to save the information. You can also collapse/expand the sub-units by clicking on the (-) and (+) on the right hand side of the sub-units to further view the company structure hierarchy.

column1: Locations
column28: Under Locations, the HR admin can add details of sites and branches of the company. You are also able to track the number of employees working for a particular location once employees are tagged to the locations when building up the PIM Module. To add a location go to Admin>>Organization>>Location and click â€œAddâ€ and the screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the fields are added. Once a location is added, it will be listed. You may also enter multiple locations. You may view location details by clicking on â€œLocation Nameâ€. To delete a location click on the check box next to the location name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: General Information
column28: Basic details of the company can be entered on this screen. To start adding information, go to Admin>> Organization>> General Information and click â€œEditâ€. Click â€œSaveâ€ once fields are entered.

column1: Organization
column28: All information about the organization, the structure and locations are defined here.

column1: Work Shifts
column28: In this feature the HR Admin can define work shifts for an individual or a group of employees. To add an entry, go to Admin>> Job>> Work Shifts and click â€œAddâ€ and a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the fields are added. You may assign employees to the particular shift by selecting the employeeâ€™s name from the â€œAvailable Employeesâ€ box and â€œAddâ€ him/her to the â€œAssigned Employeesâ€ box. An Employee list needs to be created first under the PIM Module before assigning employees to a particular work shift. A list of work shifts would appear once a â€œWork Shiftâ€ is added. To view Work Shift details, click on â€œWork Shiftâ€ name. You may also add multiple entries of work shifts. To delete a work shift click on the check box next to the â€œWork Shiftâ€â€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Job Categories
column28: This feature allows the HR Admin to create job categories specific to the company to aggregate job classifications. To add an entry, go to Admin>> Job>> Job Categories and click on â€œAddâ€ and a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. A list of Job Category would appear once a â€œJob Categoryâ€ is added. To view Job Category details, click on â€œJob Categoryâ€ name. You may also add multiple entries of Job Categories. To delete a Job Category click on the check box next to the â€œJob Categoryâ€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Employment Status
column28: Employment Status allows you to define the status of employment employees are hired for or if they are terminated. To add an entry, go to Admin>> Job>> Employment Status and click â€œAddâ€ and a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. A list of Employment Status would appear once an Employment Status is added. To edit an employment status, click on the â€œEmployment Statusâ€ name. To delete an Employment Status click on the check box next to the â€œEmployment Statusâ€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Pay Grade
column28: The HR Admin can define the pay grade by setting a minimum salary, maximum salary, step increase, and the currency to be paid in. To add an entry, go to Admin>>Job>> Pay Grades and click â€œAddâ€ and a screen would appear. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the field is added. Once you click â€œSaveâ€ the screen would appear and you can now define the currency and the minimum/maximum salary for each pay grade created. You can define the pay grade by clicking â€œAddâ€ under â€œAssigned Currenciesâ€ and then providing the pay details under â€œAdd Currencyâ€. Click â€œSaveâ€ to save the currency for the Pay Grade. You can assign multiple currencies here and each currency defined will be listed. You can edit details of a particular currency by clicking on the â€œCurrencyâ€ name. All pay grades added will be listed. To view Pay Grade details click on â€œPay Grade name. To delete a Pay Grade click on the check box next to the â€œPay Gradeâ€ name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Job Titles
column28: The job titles specific to the company can be defined in this option. To add an entry, go to Admin>> Job>> Job Titles and click â€œAddâ€. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the fields are added. A list of job title(s) will appear. You may also enter multiple job titles. You may view Job Title details by clicking on the name of the â€œJob Titleâ€. To delete a Job Title click on the check box next to the Job Title name. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Job
column28: All job related information can be defined in this feature. The sub menu consists of the following items: â— Job Titles â— Pay Grades â— Employment Status â— Job Categories â— Work Shifts

column1: User Management
column28: This feature allows the HR Admin to administer users by creating logins and defining privileges by assigning User Types (Admin or ESS). To add a system user, go to Admin>> User Management>> Users and click â€œAddâ€. Click â€œSaveâ€ once the fields are added. To create a user login the following needs to be entered: â— User Role: You can assign user roles for each user whether they would fall under as an â€œAdminâ€ or â€œESSâ€ user type to define their user rights. â— Admin: have access full access to the system. â— ESS: limited access to the system. It could be an ESS-Supervisor or ESS-Employee. 1. ESS-Supervisor: where the user has access to his/her particulars and his/her subordinatesâ€™ particulars. 2. ESS-Employee: where the user has access only to his/her particulars. â— Employee Name *If an HR Admin is an existing employee, he/she needs to be defined in the PIM Module â— Username â— Status â€“ Enabled or disabled â— Password â— Confirm Password (Re-enter the password). An employee list needs to be created first under the PIM Module to create user logins. Alternatively, a user login could be created when adding employees under the PIM Module. A list of user logins would appear once an entry is added. You may also add multiple entries of user logins. The default system user available will be Admin and has full access to the system. System User Logins need to be communicated manually to employees. To delete a system user, click on the check box next to the â€œUsernameâ€. It is also possible to delete multiple entries at the same time by clicking the check box entries you wish to delete and simply clicking â€œDeleteâ€.

column1: Admin Module
